org.libex.test.mockito.answer

Class CountDownLatchAnswer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.libex.test.mockito.answer.WrappedAnswer<T>
      • org.libex.test.mockito.answer.CountDownLatchAnswer<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.mockito.stubbing.Answer<T>

    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
@ThreadSafe
public class CountDownLatchAnswer<T>
extends WrappedAnswer<T>
    A WrappedAnswer that allows a unit test to wait until the mock has been invoked a specified number of times.
    Author:
    John Butler

      Waits for the mock to be invoked the configured number of times

      • await

        public boolean await(org.libex.concurrent.TimeSpan timeSpan)
              throws InterruptedException
        Waits for the mock to be invoked the configured number of times
        Parameters:
        timeSpan - the maximum amount of time wait
        Returns:
        true if the mock was invoked the specified number of time, false if the timeout was reached
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
